column3: The example of the fixed usage of the `retry` script: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5531561323921408
This part I don't understand. It was working "correctly" before (without retry).

Besides [Bash Reference Manual](https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/bash.html), there are more references:
- https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/22796/can-i-export-functions-in-bash
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1885871/exporting-a-function-in-shell

If shell function `retry` is used, it runs a subshell, and cannot see definitions of other shell functions unless they are
